apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

aws.description: https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/aws/index.html#configure-root-iam-credentials AWSConfiguration contains information to communicate with AWS

credentialSecret.description: Specifies the secret containing AWS access key ID and secret access key secret.Data: - access_key=<value> - secret_key=<value>

iamEndpoint.description: Specifies a custom HTTP IAM enminidpoint to use

lease.description: Specifies the lease value provided as a string duration with time suffix. "h" (hour) is the largest suffix.

leaseMax.description: Specifies the maximum lease value provided as a string duration with time suffix. "h" (hour) is the largest suffix

maxRetries.description: Number of max retries the client should use for recoverable errors. The default (-1) falls back to the AWS SDK's default behavior

stsEndpoint.description: Specifies a custom HTTP STS endpoint to use

azure.description: AzureConfiguration contains information to communicate with Azure

credentialSecret.description: Specifies the secret name containing Azure credentials secret.Data: - subscription-id: <value>, The subscription id for the Azure Active Directory. - tenant-id: <value>, The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory. - client-id: <value>, The OAuth2 client id to connect to Azure. - client-secret: <value>, The OAuth2 client secret to connect to Azure.

environment.description: The Azure environment. If not specified, Vault will use Azure Public Cloud.

elasticsearch.description: ElasticsearchConfiguration defines a Elasticsearch app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api-docs/secret/databases/elasticdb TODO: Fill in the fields

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

caCert.description: The path to a PEM-encoded CA cert file to use to verify the Elasticsearch server's identity.

caPath.description: The path to a directory of PEM-encoded CA cert files to use to verify the Elasticsearch server's identity.

clientCert.description: The path to the certificate for the Elasticsearch client to present for communication.

clientKey.description: The path to the key for the Elasticsearch client to use for communication.

databaseRef.description: Specifies the Elasticsearch database appbinding reference

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

insecure.description: Not recommended. Default to false. Can be set to true to disable SSL verification.

password.description: The password to be used in the connection URL ("pa55w0rd").

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for elasticsearch: elasticsearch-database-plugin

tlsServerName.description: This, if set, is used to set the SNI host when connecting via 1TLS.

username.description: The username to be used in the connection URL ("vault").

gcp.description: https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/gcp/index.html#write-config GCPConfiguration contains information to communicate with GCP

credentialSecret.description: Specifies the secret containing GCP credentials secret.Data: - sa.json

maxTTL.description: Specifies the maximum config TTL for long-lived credentials (i.e. service account keys).

ttl.description: Specifies default config TTL for long-lived credentials (i.e. service account keys).

kv.description: KVConfiguration defines a Key-Value engine configuration TODO: fill in doc links

casRequired.description: If true, then all operations on the KV store require the cas (Compare-and-Swap) parameter to be set. https://www.vaultproject.io/api-docs/secret/kv/kv-v2#cas_required https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/secrets/kv/kv-v2#usage

deleteVersionsAfter.description: If set, keys will be automatically deleted after this length of time. Accepts a Go duration format string. https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration

maxVersions.description: The maximum number of versions to keep for any given key. Defaults to 0, which indicates that the Vault default (10) should be used.

version.description: The version of the KV engine to enable. Defaults to "1", can be either "1" or "2"

mariadb.description: MariaDBConfiguration defines a MariaDB app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/index.html https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/mysql-maria.html#configure-connection

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

databaseRef.description: DatabaseRef refers to a MariaDB database AppBinding in any namespace

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

maxConnectionLifetime.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time a connection may be reused. If <= 0s connections are reused forever.

maxIdleConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of idle connections to the database. A zero uses the value of max_open_connections and a negative value disables idle connections. If larger than max_open_connections it will be reduced to be equal.

maxOpenConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of open connections to the database.

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for mysql: mysql-database-plugin

mongodb.description: MongoDBConfiguration defines a MongoDB app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/index.html https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/mongodb.html#configure-connection

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for mongodb: mongodb-database-plugin

writeConcern.description: Specifies the MongoDB write concern. This is set for the entirety of the session, maintained for the lifecycle of the plugin process.

mysql.description: MySQLConfiguration defines a MySQL app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/index.html https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/mysql-maria.html#configure-connection

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

databaseRef.description: DatabaseRef refers to a MySQL/MariaDB database AppBinding in any namespace

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

maxConnectionLifetime.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time a connection may be reused. If <= 0s connections are reused forever.

maxIdleConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of idle connections to the database. A zero uses the value of max_open_connections and a negative value disables idle connections. If larger than max_open_connections it will be reduced to be equal.

maxOpenConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of open connections to the database.

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for mysql: mysql-database-plugin

pki.description: https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/api-docs/secret/pki#generate-root PKIConfiguration contains information about PKI Secret Engine

parentCARef.description: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

postgres.description: PostgresConfiguration defines a PostgreSQL app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/index.html https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/postgresql.html#configure-connection

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

databaseRef.description: Specifies the Postgres database appbinding reference

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

maxConnectionLifetime.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time a connection may be reused. If <= 0s connections are reused forever.

maxIdleConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of idle connections to the database. A zero uses the value of max_open_connections and a negative value disables idle connections. If larger than max_open_connections it will be reduced to be equal.

maxOpenConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of open connections to the database.

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for postgres: postgresql-database-plugin

redis.description: RedisConfiguration defines a Redis app configuration. https://www.vaultproject.io/api/secret/databases/index.html https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/api-docs/secret/databases/redis#configure-connection

allowedRoles.description: List of the roles allowed to use this connection. Defaults to empty (no roles), if contains a "*" any role can use this connection.

name.description: `name` is the name of the app. Required

namespace.description: `namespace` is the namespace of the app. Required

parameters.description:
Parameters is a set of the parameters to be used to override default parameters. The inline YAML/JSON payload to be translated into equivalent JSON object. 
 The Parameters field is NOT secret or secured in any way and should NEVER be used to hold sensitive information.

pluginName.description: Specifies the name of the plugin to use for this connection. Default plugin: - for redis: redis-database-plugin

vaultRef.description: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

items.description: Condition defines an observation of a object operational state.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another. This should be when the underlying condition changed. If that is not known, then using the time when the API field changed is acceptable.

message.description: A human-readable message indicating details about the transition. This field may be empty.

observedGeneration.description: If set, this represents the .metadata.generation that the condition was set based upon. For instance, if .metadata.generation is currently 12, but the .status.condition[x].observedGeneration is 9, the condition is out of date with respect to the current state of the instance.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition in CamelCase. The specific API may choose whether this field is considered a guaranteed API. This field may not be empty.

severity.description: Severity provides an explicit classification of Reason code, so the users or machines can immediately understand the current situation and act accordingly. The Severity field MUST be set only when Status=False.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description: Type of condition in CamelCase or in foo.example.com/CamelCase. Many .condition.type values are consistent across resources like Available, but because arbitrary util can be useful (see .node.status.util), the ability to deconflict is important.

path.description: Path defines the path used to enable this secret engine Visible to user but immutable
